quoteFirst: 29 Bombardment continued, 513 shells (25 from 9 to 10:30 A. M.; 100 at 2 P. M.; 50 from
quoteLast: ; 300 from 9 to 10 P. M.; 30 in the night). M. Martin, decorated by the President on June 18, killed by a shell at the temporary Sous-Préfecture near Reims.
title: The Bombardment of Reims
author: Ferree, Barr, 1862-1924

quoteFirst: Inspectors of nuisances have two hours’ written examination on the first day, viz. from
quoteLast: On the second day the examination for both classes commences at 11 A.M., and is _vivâ voce_; with one or more questions to be answered in writing if deemed necessary. A certificate of competence signed by the examiners is granted to successful candidates.
title: The Municipal and Sanitary Engineer's Handbook
author: Boulnois, H. Percy (Henry Percy), 1846-1927

quoteFirst: Horner at her elbow, to see if such petitions, as to be allowed to plough up pasture fields, were provided for in the terms of the original agreement. On every Thursday she made herself at liberty to see her tenants, from
quoteTime: four to six in the afternoon
quoteLast: . Mornings would have suited my lady better, as far as convenience went, and I believe the old custom had been to have these levees (as her ladyship used to call them) held before twelve. But, as she said to Mr. Horner, when he urged returning to the former hours, it spoilt a whole day for a farmer, if he had to dress himself in his best and leave his work in the forenoon (and my lady liked to see her tenants come in their Sunday clothes; she would not say a word, maybe, but she would take her spectacles slowly out, and put them on with silent gravity, and look at a dirty or
title: My Lady Ludlow
author: Gaskell, Elizabeth Cleghorn, 1810-1865

quoteFirst:
They bent their heads over them for a time.

“That’s it. At
quoteLast:
by yours. Seven to by mine.”

It was the cuirassier who remained by the side of General D’Hubert, keeping his one eye fixed immovably on the white face of the watch he held in the palm of his hand.
title: A Set of Six
author: Conrad, Joseph, 1857-1924

quoteFirst: “That'll do when you get him,” objected Benella, “though boys need a lot of overseeing; but as nobody can get in or come out o' that gate without help, I shall have to go to the lodge every day now, and set down there with my sewin' from
quoteTime: four to six in the afternoon
quoteLast: , or whenever the callin' hours is. When I engaged with you, it wasn't for any particular kind of work; it was to make myself useful.
title: Penelope's Irish Experiences
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith, 1856-1923

quoteLast: Beatty sights Jellicoe and shifts to easterly course at utmost speed.
title: A True Account of the Battle of Jutland, May 31, 1916
author: Frothingham, Thomas Goddard, 1865-1945
